source_sentence: 乃是一切菩薩摩訶薩所敬禮處。
translation: It's a place where all bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, and worshipers venerate.

source_sentence: 亦是一切如來祕密心中甚深之藏。
translation: It's also the profound storehouse of the secret mind of all tathāgatas.

source_sentence: 復是觀世音最上祕密心真言。
translation: It's also the true saying of Avalokitêśvara's supreme, secret mind.
It can remove all karmic hindrances that accompany dormancy.
It can purify all supramundane paths of reality.

source_sentence: 能入一切不空如來種族之門。
translation: It can enter the gate of all the nonempty tathāgatas' seeds.
This is the true saying of the perfection of generosity.

source_sentence: 那莫薩縛嚲詑誐跢南(一句)那莫旖唎耶(二句)縛路枳諦濕縛囉野(三句)菩地薩埵野(四句)摩訶薩埵野(五句)摩訶迦嚕抳迦野(六句)唵(抬聲引呼下同)旖暮伽(上七句)摩訶娜那(去)播囉弭哆(八句)播哩布囉野(九句)[合*牛]娜囉娜囉(十句)弭弭馱弭質怛(登訖反二合)[口*(隸-木+士)](十一句)薩縛薩怛(同上)廡播抱誐(十二句)薩縛嚲詑誐跢(十三句)摩訶娜那(去)布惹米偈(平十四句)跛(二合同上)囉襪嚲野(十五句)嚲囉嚲囉(十六句)嚲囉耶(十七句)摩訶鉢(二合)頭麼播抳(十八句)[合*牛][怡-台+巿]莎(二合)縛訶(十九句)世尊若有有情修治布施。
translation: "Namosavartan (one phrase) Namoragiri (two phrases) Varuṇa-ketitaiśvara (three phrases) Bodhisattvara (four phrases) Mahāsattvara (five phrases) Mahākārajña (six phrases) Om (the same as the next in raising the voice) Yamogha (the seventh phrase above) Mahānāna (departing) Pārāvatā (eight phrases) Pārijāta (nine phrases) [H*Niu] Nārānara (ten phrases) Vimalamitra (two phrases) [Mouth*(Ṛki+Shi)] (eleven phrases) Sadvasatā (ibid.)

source_sentence: 以此一切如來不空所生布施波羅蜜多真言海雲三昧耶供養。
translation: They make offerings with this true saying, "All tathāgatas are not in vain, but are produced by generosity, pāramitā, and sea-cloud samaya.
He makes offerings to body and mind that are cultivated.
They will then attain all the tathāgatas in the ten directions.

source_sentence: 一切布施波羅蜜多圓滿相應。
translation: All generosity pāramitās are perfectly matched.
They'll reach unsurpassed correct perfect enlightenment.
Their merits won't falter.
True Words of the Perfection of Pure Morality

source_sentence: 那莫薩嚩嚲詑誐跢南(一句)那莫旖唎耶(二句)縛路枳諦濕縛囉野(三句)菩地薩埵野(四句)摩訶薩埵野(五句)摩訶迦嚕抳迦野(六句)唵旖暮伽(上)始攞(七句)三(去)皤囉三(去)皤囉(八句)皤囉皤囉(九句)秫陀(上)薩埵(二合)縛鉢(二合)頭麼(十句)弭步使嚲步惹(十一句)馱囉馱囉(十二句)三(去)曼嚲婆(同上)路枳跢(十三句)[合*牛][怡-台+巿]莎(二合)縛訶(十四句)世尊若有有情修治淨戒。
translation: "Namasatha (one phrase) Namasalaya (two phrases) Vālukotīśvara (three phrases) Bodhisattvara (four phrases) Mahāsattvara (five phrases) Mahākārajñjana (six phrases) Om Yamogha (above) Śīlā (seven phrases) Samantabhadra (above) Raurava (eight phrases) Raurava (nine phrases) Kammadā (above) Sattva (two combinations) Vubhā (two combinations) Dharma (ten phrases) Vipulya (eleven phrases) Dharādhara (twelve phrases) Samantabhadra (as above) Vālukotī (thirteen phrases) [Ha*Niu][Yi-Tai+Mai] Sa (two combinations) Vāha (fourteen phrases) Bhagavān, if there are sentient beings who cultivate the pure precepts.

source_sentence: 以此一切如來不空菩提所生淨戒波羅蜜多真言海雲三昧耶供養。
translation: They make offerings with this true saying, 'Ocean cloud samaya of pure precepts produced from the nonempty enlightenment of all tathāgatas.'
It will bless their body and mind.

source_sentence: 當得十方一切如來一切淨戒波羅蜜多具足相應。
translation: It will then be fully associated with all the tathāgatas in the ten directions and all the prajñāpāramitā of pure precepts.
The fragrance of the precepts will permeate the ten directions.

source_sentence: 若苾芻苾芻尼破淨戒者。
translation: If a monk or nun breaks the pure precepts, that monk or nun won't eat for a day on the fifteenth day of every white moon.

source_sentence: 每白月十五日一日不食。
translation: They must abstain from eating for one day on the fifteenth day of every white moon.
He recites this samaya.
They'll attain the concomitance of the pure precepts aggregate.

source_sentence: 直至無上正等菩提而不退失。
translation: They'll attain unsurpassed correct perfect enlightenment and won't lose it.
Sthiramati-varamitra-sūtra

source_sentence: 以此一切如來不空無上法覺安忍波羅蜜多真言海雲三昧耶供養。
translation: They make offerings to the Tathāgata, the nonempty, unsurpassed Dharma awakening, and the forbearance pāramitā, the true saying, "ocean cloud samaya.
It will bless their body and mind.

source_sentence: 當得十方一切如來一切安忍波羅蜜多圓滿相應。
translation: They will then attain the perfect correspondence with all the Tathāgatas in the ten directions and all the pāramitās of forbearance.

source_sentence: 直至無上正等菩提而不退失。
translation: He'll reach unsurpassed perfect enlightenment without ever retrogressing.
Zhenyan pāramitā zeal

source_sentence: 以此一切如來不空不捨生死精進波羅蜜多真言海雲三昧耶供養。
translation: By making offerings with this true saying, "All tathāgatas are not empty, don't abandon birth-and-death effort," the ocean cloud samaya.
It will bless their body and mind.

source_sentence: 當得十方一切如來一切精進波羅蜜多圓滿相應。
translation: It will then be fully associated with all the Tathāgatas in the ten directions and all the perfections of effort.

source_sentence: 直至無上正等菩提而不退失。
translation: They'll reach unsurpassed perfect enlightenment and won't lose it.
True Words of the Perfection of Concentration

translation: "Nāmosavatantan (one phrase) Nāmoriyagayā (two phrases) Varuṇa-kitiśvara (three phrases) Bodhisattvara (four phrases) Mahāsattvara (five phrases) Mahākārajña (six phrases) Omasavatan (seven phrases) Mahāmogha-kāraṇa (eight phrases) Nāgārjuna (eight phrases) [k*yau] Nasar (go) Mady (nine phrases) Vemokṣaprāpta (two contracts upward) Rājagṛha [and *yā] (and also the reverse) Ten phrases) Śrāvastī (eleven phrases) [hap*niu] [yi-tai + mai] sā (two together) Vākha (twelve phrases) Bhagavān, if there are sentient beings cultivating meditation.

source_sentence: 以此一切如來不空無上靜慮波羅蜜多真言海雲三昧耶供養。
translation: They make offerings with this ocean cloud samaya, the true words of the Tathāgata's nonempty, unsurpassed meditation pāramitā.
He blesses his body and mind.
He resembles the form of Avalokitêśvara.
He'll wear Avalokitêśvara on his head.

source_sentence: 當得十方一切如來一切靜慮波羅蜜多圓滿相應。
translation: He'll attain the full correspondence of all the Tathāgatas in the ten directions and all the pāramitās of meditation.
He'll be born in the land of the Buddha of Immeasurable Life.

source_sentence: 得一切三昧耶現前通解。
translation: He'll attain unimpeded understanding of all the samaya in the present.

source_sentence: 直至無上正等菩提更不退失。
translation: He'll attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment and never lose it again.
True Prajñāpāramitā Words

source_sentence: 以此一切如來不空無上般若波羅蜜多真言海雲三昧耶供養。
translation: They make offerings with this ocean cloud samaya, the true words of the Tathāgata, the nonempty, unsurpassed prajñāpāramitā.
He blesses his body and mind.

source_sentence: 當得十方一切如來一切般若波羅蜜多方便善巧圓滿相應。
translation: They will then attain the complete correspondence of all the Tathāgatas in the ten directions and all the prajñāpāramitās that are skillful and complete in their methods.

source_sentence: 直至無上正等菩提而不退失。
translation: He'll attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment and won't lose it.

source_sentence: 不空羂索神變真言經卷第十五
translation: Bukong juansuo shenmi zhenyan jing, vol. 15
